[HEADING] MBA Manchester Full-Time MBA / Overview
[HEADING] Course options
[HEADING] Course overview
[HEADING] Open days

[HEADING] Scholarships/sponsorships

[HEADING] Regulated by the Office for Students
Attend an open day
Download our course brochure
Discover more about
Year of entry: 2025
To view the full entry requirements, please visit the         Alliance Manchester Business School
 website.
Full entry requirements
To apply for the Full-time MBA you will need to submit the online application form and the application documents listed below:
Attend an open day
Download our course brochure
Discover more about
Are you an ambitious professional looking to transform yourself, your career and your life?
The Manchester Full-time MBA is one of the world's most practical MBAs. You will gain unbeatable experience for your CV by taking on three consultancy projects with real clients. It doesn't get more hands-on than that.
Our programme offers the flexibility to change programme length, personal careers support, an international alumni network, electives at five global centres, internship opportunities and more.
For full programme information, please visit the       Alliance Manchester Business School
 website.
Do you want to find out more about whether an MBA is right for you or how it could help your career? We deliver regular information sessions and offer one-to-one consultations to all prospective candidates.
For further information, please visit the       Alliance Manchester Business School website.
For  entry in the academic year beginning September 2025, the tuition fees are as follows:
Further information for EU students can be found on our dedicated EU page.
All students should normally be able to complete their programme of study without incurring additional study costs over and above the tuition fee for that programme. Any unavoidable additional compulsory costs totalling more than 1% of the annual home undergraduate fee per annum, regardless of whether the programme in question is undergraduate or postgraduate taught, will be made clear to you at the point of application. Further information can be found in the University's Policy on additional costs incurred by students on undergraduate and postgraduate taught programmes (PDF document, 91KB).
We offer a generous range of scholarships every year and all self-funding applicants are automatically considered as part of the admissions process. To view a full list of scholarships, please visit the         Alliance Manchester Business School website
 .
All graduates of the University of Manchester or UMIST receive a loyalty bursary. This is a 20% discount on the tuition fees that they are personally funding.
Use the links below to view lists of courses in related subject areas.
The University of Manchester is regulated by the Office for Students (OfS). The OfS aims to help students succeed in Higher Education by ensuring they receive excellent information and guidance, get high quality education that prepares them for the future and by protecting their interests. More information can be found at the OfS website.
You can find regulations and policies relating to student life at The University of Manchester, including our Degree Regulations and Complaints Procedure, on our regulations website.
• View tabs
• View full page
• Minimum of three years' post-graduation work experience with strong, consistent career progression and achievement
• Good undergraduate degree or international equivalent
• Satisfactory GMAT          ®
, GRE          ®
 (or MAT in some circumstances)
• International exposure (valued)
• Entrepreneurial experience (valued)
• Strong team player
• Excellent communication skills
• Emotional intelligence and personal qualities

• Admission essay
• Degree transcript(s) and certificate(s) or professional qualifications
• Admissions test report: GMAT, GRE (or MAT in some circumstances)
• English Language score report (if applicable)

Degree awarded: Master of Business Administration
Duration: 18 or 15 months (full-time)
Entry requirements: Minimum of three years' post-graduation work experience with strong, consistent career progression and achievement

To view the full entry requirements, please visit the         Alliance Manchester Business School
 website.      


Full entry requirements
Number of places/applicants: Typically there are 100 students per class representing 30 nationalities.
How to apply: To apply for the Full-time MBA you will need to submit the online application form and the application documents listed below:   CV Admission essay Degree transcript(s) and certificate(s) or professional qualifications Admissions test report: GMAT, GRE (or MAT in some circumstances) English Language score report (if applicable)  We also require at least one reference (we will email your referees our online reference form after you submit the application form). Please visit the Alliance Manchester Business School website to view full details of the application process.
[DEFINITION_LIST]
School/Faculty: Alliance Manchester Business School
Contact name: MBA Recruitment Team
Email: mba@manchester.ac.uk
Website: http://www.alliancembs.ac.uk/study/mba/full-time/
School/Faculty: Alliance Manchester Business School was established in 1965 as one of the UK's first two business schools. Today, we are the UK's largest campus-based business and management school, and 'Original Thinking Applied' is at the heart of everything we do.       Find out more
.

[HEADING] Taught master's study at Manchester
[HEADING] Meet us
[HEADING] Information sessions
[HEADING] Contact us
[HEADING] Study fairs and visits
[HEADING] International students
[HEADING] Why Manchester?
[HEADING] Award-winning Careers Service
[HEADING] Making a difference
[HEADING] Best UK city to live
[HEADING] Global reputation
[HEADING] A diverse community
Shape your future
Learn today, lead tomorrow
Join our one-hour information sessions with our UK and International Recruitment Teams.
Book a session
Have a question about master's study or an application you've submitted?
Get in touch with us
We attend study fairs and visits throughout the year, so you can meet us near you.
Find a study fair
Find entry requirements, contact details and country-specific events.
Learn more : international students
Award-winning Careers Service
2nd most targeted university by leading graduate employers.
(The Graduate Market in 2024, High Fliers Research)
Our graduates are among the most targeted by the UK's top graduate employers, giving you the best chance to get ahead in your future career.
Throughout your studies, and for two years after you graduate, you can access our award-winning Careers Service, which provides one-to-one tailored support and events to help you develop valuable skills.
Find out more about your employability opportunities and our Careers Service.
Making a difference
Number one in the UK and Europe and number two in the world for social and environmental impact.
(Times Higher Education Impact Rankings, 2025)
Social responsibility is one of our core goals and we are committed to creating a healthier, fairer and greener world through research, teaching and learning, and public engagement.
With us, you will have the opportunity to make an ethical, social, and environmental difference in society through student volunteering, online courses, and activities.
Read how you can get involved in socially responsible activities at Manchester.
Best UK city to live
Manchester is rated the top UK city to live in.
(The Economist Global Liveability Index, 2022)
The first of Britain's great modern cities, Manchester is a true original; a confident, creative, contemporary city that likes to do things differently.
The city, and surrounding Greater Manchester, offers an exciting mix of sport, entertainment, art and culture, shopping, and much more.
Discover Manchester.
Our global reputation
35th best university in the world.
(QS World University Rankings, 2026)
We are also the 11th best in Europe and the 7th best in the UK.
Our reputation is built on research and we have the credentials to match. You will benefit from our continuous investment in research facilities and master's courses that are led by distinguished tutors working at the forefront of their subjects.
Explore all our University rankings.
Inclusive and diverse community
We are home to more than 14,400 international students from outside the EU.
Each year, the quality of our teaching and research welcomes one of the largest international student populations in the UK to our University.
We welcome students from 160 countries each year from all over the world, creating a truly multicultural University with an exciting and friendly community.
Find out more about international study at Manchester.

pages.content:
[HEADING] MBA Manchester Full-Time MBA / Careers
[HEADING] Career opportunities
[HEADING] Accrediting organisations
Attend an open day
Download our course brochure
Discover more about
Year of entry: 2025
Whatever your background, the Manchester Full-time MBA could help you change industry, secure a promotion, boost your salary or relocate to a new country. Where will it take you?
We are part of a select group of business schools globally that holds triple accreditation from AACSB, AMBA and EQUIS.
To find out more about our rankings and accreditations, please visit the       Alliance Manchester Business School website
.
• View tabs
• View full page
• 86% 
of graduates seeking a role had accepted an offer within 3 months of graduating (Financial Times Global MBA Ranking 2024).
• 108% 
average salary increase 3 years after graduation (Financial Times Global MBA Ranking 2024).
• $140,238
 average salary 3 years after graduating (Financial Times Global MBA Ranking 2024).
[GRID_TABLE]
Attend an open day
Download our course brochure
Discover more about
pages.title: MBA Manchester Full-Time MBA - careers (2025 entry) | The University of Manchester

pages.content:
[HEADING] MBA Manchester Full-Time MBA / Course details
[HEADING] Course description
[HEADING] Aims
[HEADING] Teaching and learning
[HEADING] Course unit details
[HEADING] Scholarships and bursaries
[HEADING] What our students say
[HEADING] Disability support
[HEADING] CPD opportunities
Attend an open day
Download our course brochure
Discover more about
Year of entry: 2025
The Manchester MBA develops socially-responsible leaders who can navigate global challenges. We will teach you to reflect intelligently in real business situations and on your own professional development.
Key features
Key benefits
This holistic MBA degree will help you:
Our MBA programme produces creative, resilient and socially-responsibly graduates who will thrive in the technological age. We  continuously update our curriculum to ensure it focuses on the business challenges you will face as a leader, now and in the future. You will learn to navigate uncertainty and confidently take on complex challenges.
We have been an expert in applied learning since the 1960s. Our renowned Manchester Method focuses on group work, practice-based learning and reflection. We don't just give you the theory; we show you how to use it to get immediate results.
The Manchester Method in action
You can study the Full-time MBA over 18 or 15 months and all candidates follow the same core programme. You will build the rest of your MBA around the fields that interest you.
Core courses
Our core programme will give you a thorough grounding in key areas of business and management and challenge you to take on three group consultancy projects with real clients. You will study the following courses:
Design your MBA
This is your chance to build a personal MBA experience, whether you're looking to explore a new industry, make contacts overseas or develop knowledge and skills in a specific area. You will choose from the following options:
For full programme information, please visit the       Alliance Manchester Business School
 website.
We offer a generous range of scholarships every year and all  self-funding applicants are automatically considered as part of the  admissions process. To view a full list of scholarships, please visit  the         Alliance Manchester Business School website
 .
All  graduates of the University of Manchester or UMIST receive a loyalty  bursary. This is a 20% discount on the tuition fees that they are  personally funding.
'The AMBS community supported me throughout the journey. I was helped by seniors from different parts of the world, who provided insight and guidance during the recruiting process. In addition, the career service was hands-on in offering consultation and connecting me to the right people.'
Josephine Audreylia, Indonesian
Associate, McKinsey & Co, Jakarta
• View tabs
• View full page
• Study over 18 or 15 months
• Take on 3 live client consultancy projects
• Get the global edge: international cohort; overseas client consultancy; study abroad opportunities; and alumni in 176 countries
• Build your own MBA: options include internship; Shanghai and Dubai study tours; elective courses in Dubai, Hong Kong, Manchester, Shanghai and Singapore; and international exchange
• Focus on social responsibility
• Access career support and mentoring
• Develop critical thinking, creativity and confidence
• Boost your collaboration and communication skills
• Learn to navigate uncertain, complex situations
• Improve your resilience
• Four days of team building activities in the Lake District
• Group work with a diverse class
• Three increasingly complex live client consultancy projects: Not-for-Profit Consultancy Project > Commercial Business Consultancy Project > International Business Consultancy Project
• 10-12 week internship (optional)
• Regular reflective sessions with an external practitioner
• Simulated Mergers & Acquisitions Project
• Practical case studies
• Guest Speaker Series and business networking
• Leading and Managing in a Global Environment
• Business Accounting and Finance
• Strategy and Competition
• Operations and Marketing
• Exploring Management & Business Practice
• Not-for-Profit Consultancy Project
• Mergers & Acquisitions Project
• Commercial Business Consultancy Project
• International Business Consultancy Project
• Electives with workshops in Dubai, Hong Kong, Manchester, Shanghai and Singapore
• 8-12 week internship
• Global study tour to our centres in Dubai and/or Shanghai

pages.content:
[HEADING] Master's courses at The University of Manchester
[HEADING] Course finder
You may already have a good idea of which master's course you wish to study – or you may be interested more generally in a particular subject area.
We can help you find the right master's course for you, regardless of what stage of the decision-making process you are at. You can browse our postgraduate taught courses using our course finder, or explore our full list of subject areas.
A-Z list of courses
The University of Manchester provides approved course information only to the following trusted sites: UCAS, Hotcourses, TARGETcourses, Prospects, Education UK, MastersPortal.eu, FindAMasters and MastersCompare. Information found on any other external site is not approved or supported by the University, and may not be current or reliable.

program_name: 曼彻斯特大学工商管理硕士
